intro: Linaria kurdica subsp. sintenisii, commonly known as the Kurdish toadflax, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Turkey and Iran. It belongs to the plant family Plantaginaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and clusters of yellow-orange flowers. The species is distinguished by its lance-shaped leaves and the presence of glandular hairs on its foliage. It thrives in rocky and calcareous soils, often growing in alpine or subalpine environments. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
